result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tristan E Ankeny

records.addlTxt: Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

11:32 AM Defendant Tristan E Ankeny not in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Tristan E Ankeny.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.  Def fails to appear.  State requests warrant.  Atty Anderson stands mute.  Court orders warrant, $750 cash bond, only judge may quash.  Court orders cash bond posted.

9:22 AM Defendant Tristan E Ankeny appeared by phone.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Tristan E Ankeny.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: waiting on lab results, offer has been made, defense waiting to see lab results before sending a counter-offer.  State updates re: lab reports not back yet, but lab received the substances for testing 5/3/22.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 11:15 am.

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tristan E Ankeny appeared by phone.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Tristan E Ankeny. Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Court approves phone appearance for next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tristan E Ankeny appeared by phone.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Tristan E Ankeny. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on June 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.
Letter from atty Anderson asking to quash warrant and reinstate bond

11:42 AM Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear.  Witness appear ready, able, and willing to testify as case is set for preliminary hearing.  State asks to forfeit any cash and for warrant.  Atty Anderson stands mute.  Court orders warrant, $750 cash, only judge may quash.  Court orders cash bond posted forfeited.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 11:15 am.

02:04 PM Defendant, Tristan E Ankeny, appeared with Attorney Fredric B. Anderson.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Def appears telephonically.  Atty Anderson by video.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered to misdmeanors.  WTLPH.  Discussion of Zoom possibilities for PH w/proper waivers.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Letter to Judge Request to Appear Remotely

The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
